    Landscape variables

    getLandscapeLayer.Rd

    Extract or estimate variables from objects SpatialPointsLandscape-class, SpatialPixelsLandscape-class or SpatialGridLandscape-class.

    getLandscapeLayer(obj, variable, SpParams = NULL, ...)
getLandscapeVariable(obj, variable, SpParams = NULL, ...)

    Arguments

    obj

    An object of class SpatialPointsLandscape-class, SpatialPixelsLandscape-class or SpatialGridLandscape-class.

    variable

    A string with the name of the variable to extract (see details).

    SpParams

    A data frame with species parameters (see SpParamsMED), required for most forest stand variables.

    ...

    Additional arguments (not used).

    Details

    The following string values are available for variable.

    Topography:

    • "elevation":Elevation in m.

    • "slope":Slope in degrees.

    • "aspect":Slope in degrees.

    • "lct":Land cover type.

    Soil:

    • "texture1":Texture class of the first soil layer.

    • "texture2":Texture class of the second soil layer.

    • "texture3":Texture class of the third soil layer.

    • "SoilVolExtract":Total water extractable volume (mm).

    • "SoilVolSAT":Total water volume at saturation (mm).

    • "SoilVolFC":Total water volume at field capacity (mm).

    • "SoilVolWP":Total water volume at wilting point (mm).

    • "SoilVolCurr":Current total water volume (mm).

    Watershed:

    • "numNeigh":Number of cell neighbours (integer).

    • "waterOrder":Cell order for lateral water transfer (integer).

    • "outlets":Water outlet (TRUE/FALSE).

    • "channel":Water channel (TRUE/FALSE).

    • "DepthToBedrock":Depth to bedrock (m).

    • "RockPorosity":Bedrock porosity.

    • "RockConductivity":Bedrock conductivity.

    • "AquiferElevation":Aquifer elevation over bedrock (m).

    • "DepthToAquifer":Depth to aquifer (m).

    • "AquiferVolume":Aquifer volume (mm).

    • "Snowpack":Snowpack water equivalent (mm).

    Forest stand:

    • "basalArea":Basal area (m2/ha).

    • "LAI":Leaf area index (m2/m2).

    • "foliarBiomass":Foliar biomass (kg/m2).

    • "fuel":Fine live fuel (kg/m2).

    • "phytovolume":Shrub phytovolume (m3/m2).

    Value

    Function getLandscapeLayer returns an object of class SpatialPointsDataFrame, SpatialPixelsDataFrame or SpatialGridDataFrame, depending on the input. Function getLandscapeVariable returns a numeric or character vector.

    Author

    Miquel De Cáceres Ainsa, CREAF.

    See also

    forest, soil, summary.forest, shinyplotland

    Examples

    #Load data and species parameters from medfate
data(examplepointslandscape)
data(SpParamsMED)

#Calculate basal area for all forest stands
y <- getLandscapeLayer(examplepointslandscape, "basalArea")

#Plot basal area
spplot(y)


# More straigthforwardly
plot(examplepointslandscape, "basalArea")
